A.text: In the majority of menstrual cycles, at least five symptoms must be present in the final week before the onset of menses, start to improve within a few days after the onset of menses, and become minimal or absent in the week postmenses.

B.text: One (or more) of the following symptoms must be present:

nest.1: Marked affective lability (e.g., mood swings: feeling suddenly sad or tearful, or increased sensitivity to rejection).
nest.2: Marked irritability or anger or increased interpersonal conflicts.
nest.3: Marked depressed mood, feelings of hopelessness, or self-deprecating thoughts.
nest.4: Marked anxiety, tension, and/or feelings of being keyed up or on edge.

C.text: One (or more) of the following symptoms must additionally be present, to reach a total of five symptoms when combined with symptoms from Criterion B above:

nest.1: Decreased interest in usual activities (e.g., work, school, friends, hobbies).
nest.3: Lethargy, easy fatigability, or marked lack of energy.
nest.4: Marked change in appetite; overeating; or specific food cravings.
nest.6: A sense of being ovenwhelmed or out of control.
nest.7: Physical symptoms such as breast tenderness or swelling, joint or muscle pain, a sensation of “bloating,” or weight gain.

Note1.text: The symptoms in Criteria A-C must have been met for most menstrual cycles that occurred in the preceding year.

D.text: The symptoms are associated with clinically significant distress or interference with work, school, usual social activities, or relationships with others (e.g., avoidance of social activities; decreased productivity and efficiency at work, school, or home).

E.text: The disturbance is not merely an exacerbation of the symptoms of another disorder, such as major depressive disorder, panic disorder, persistent depressive disorder (dysthymia), or a personality disorder (although it may co-occur with any of these disorders).

F.text: Criterion A should be confirmed by prospective daily ratings during at least two symptomatic cycles. (Note: The diagnosis may be made provisionally prior to this confirmation).

G.text: The symptoms are not attributable to the physiological effects of a substance (e.g., a drug of abuse, a medication, other treatment) or another medical condition (e.g., hyperthyroidism).
